revival.translation[0].definitions[0].de: a process in which something becomes active or strong again
revival.translation[0].definitions[0].ex: The US and the UK have expectations of economic revival.
A revival of the timber industry is needed.
There has been a revival of interest in Picasso’s work.
revival.translation[0].definitions[1].ex: Traditional English food seems to be enjoying a revival at the moment.
the recent revival in medieval music
revival.translation[0].definitions[2].de: a new production of a play that has not been performed for a long time
revival.translation[0].definitions[2].ex: Neeson was excellent in a revival of Eugene O‘Neill’s ’Anna Christie'.
revival.translation[1].definitions[0].de: when something becomes active or strong again
revival.translation[1].definitions[0].ex: Various surveys show a revival in consumer confidence.
Some people feared a revival of inflation.
revival.translation[1].definitions[1].ex: the revival of this style of furniture
American fashion designers are beginning to enjoy a revival.
